message.content:
cs.HC, cs.IR, cs.RO, cs.CYBER, cs.CL 

This paper focuses on the development and evaluation of a new interaction approach for pointing devices that reside on the keyboard. As such, it is likely to fall under the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) category. Additionally, the paper discusses the optimization of the device through a series of studies, which could fall under Information Retrieval (cs.IR) or Robotics (cs.RO) categories. The paper also discusses the reduction of discomfort, which could fall under the Cybersecurity (cs.CYBER) category. Finally, the paper mentions the use of Fitts law, which is a common evaluation method in Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) and could be relevant to this paper.
